metadata.titel_preek: A Personal Word At Evening For Ministers And Others

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Lamb (Christ) prevails to open the sealed book of history and redemption because He was slain, thereby establishing the pattern for all subsequent ministry.

tekstueel_bewijs: the Lion of the tribe of Judah... hath prevailed to open the book
He came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat on the throne
thou wast slain, and has redeemed us to God by thy blood

object.identificatie: Redemption and the Revelation of Mystery
tekstueel_bewijs: to open the book and to loose the seals thereof
to bring to an end the reign of Satan
the redemption of the people of the earth

zender.identificatie: God (Him that sat on the throne)
tekstueel_bewijs: the right hand of him that sat on the throne

ontvanger.identificatie: The Redeemed (every kindred, tongue, people, and nation)
tekstueel_bewijs: has redeemed us to God by thy blood
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as a Receiver of this redemption who then becomes a secondary Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: somewhere in the wounds of the hands also resided the power to open the book
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who uses suffering as the instrument.
helper.rol_van_geest: The Spirit is the one who 'revives the soul' when the Subject is spent.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Reign of Satan / Human Unworthiness
tekstueel_bewijs: no man in heaven, nor on earth... was able to open the book
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is the total inability of the created order to achieve its own redemption.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The minister (Subject) seeks authenticity and authority (Object) through the acceptance of suffering (Helper).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Minister/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The minister's authority is a participation in the Lamb's authority, derived specifically from the same source: suffering.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He came and took the book
The Holy Spirit revives my soul again
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We move along on the fringes
You and I will not want to court being hurt
If you can take whatever deep hurt... and hold it up before God

voorbeelden: every Christian minister ought to learn to say
deeply yearned to have a sense of authority
this has been a burning aspiration
one will discover that whatever authenticity we are to have lies beneath externals
no man... was able to open the book
resided the power to open the book
If there is anything you can do with it, take it, and use it

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the source of 'Power' (Pouvoir). It acknowledges human 'Inability' and locates 'Ability' solely in the Lamb's suffering, which the minister must then 'accept' (Vouloir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the search for 'worthiness' (S2) to the 'weeping' of failure (~S2), then to the Lamb's victory through death (S1), and finally warns against the 'insulation' (~S1) of the modern minister.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Authority is not found in human worthiness but in the 'minus' of human suffering offered to God.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'weeping' and the 'reign of Satan' are treated as cosmic realities.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains many 'you' imperatives, they are invitations to 'passivity' (accepting suffering) rather than 'activity' (moral performance). The source of all power is Christ's finished work.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on ministerial 'authenticity' as a goal
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: discovering our authenticity, or our authority

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Christ as the only Worthy Subject
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: no man was found worthy... but the Lamb

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Grace as endowment of power to the incompetent
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: If there is anything you can do with it, take it, and use it

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Great preachers (Spurgeon, Fosdick, King) are used not as moral examples to imitate, but as 'vessels of suffering' to prove the thesis that God works through weakness.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already maintains a theocentric reading by emphasizing that these men did their work 'against' their flaws, not because of their virtues.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the pressure of 'external' performance; comfort in the midst of personal pain.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The primary program (Christ's victory) and secondary program (the minister's life) are perfectly fused through the theology of the Cross.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'selfish desire for authority' and 'God's project'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: has redeemed us to God by thy blood

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit 'revives the soul' when human 'Pouvoir' is exhausted.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; requires the blood of the Lamb to break the seals.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions Christ as the primary Subject and the hearer as a participant in His suffering.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the current identification with the 'weeping' John who beholds the Lamb.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Vouloir (the desire for authenticity).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Savoir (the knowledge of Christ's specific work).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'wounds' of the minister more explicitly to the 'justification' of the sinner.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of theocentric preaching that transforms human suffering from a 'Opponent' into a 'Helper' through the lens of the Cross.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'informal' tone and use of anecdotes; Greimas reveals that these anecdotes are actually actantial proofs of the 'Pouvoir' of the Lamb.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the meaning of 'seven seals'; Greimas focuses on the 'Subject-Object' movement of opening them.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'authority' the preacher seeks is actually the 'Object' of the narrative, which can only be reached if the preacher switches from being the 'Subject' to being a 'Receiver' of Christ's wounds.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Theology of the Cross' to bridge the gap between the primary soteriological narrative and the secondary ministerial narrative.
